list.abs: 市,市字的解释,查字典 ... 市斤[ jin] 市侩[ sordid merchant;gigman;opportunist] 市两[ liang, a unit of weight].
The poor family lived in a sordid hut ., 这个穷人家住在一个污秽的小屋里面.
He has sordid motives on us ., 他对我们有卑鄙的动机.
I want no part of this sordid business ., 我决不卷入这一卑鄙勾当.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a medical term in the sense 'purulent'): from French sordide or Latin sordidus, from sordere 'be dirty'. The current senses date from the early 17th cent

entry.def: If you describe someone's behaviour as sordid, you mean that it is immoral or dishonest.

example.ex: He sat with his head buried in his hands as his sordid double life was revealed...
example.tran: 自己卑鄙的双重生活被揭穿后，他双手抱头坐在那里。

example.ex: I don't want to hear the sordid details of your relationship with Sandra...
example.tran: 我不想听你和桑德拉之间的那些龌龊细节。

entry.tran: (地方)肮脏的，令人不快的，令人沮丧的
entry.def: If you describe a place as sordid, you mean that it is dirty, unpleasant, or depressing.

example.ex: ...the attic windows of their sordid little rooms.
example.tran: 他们那些肮脏的小房间的阁楼窗户

sentences.sentence: "sleazy storefronts with...dirt on the walls"- Seattle Weekly
"the sordid details of his orgies stank under his very nostrils"- James Joyce
"the squalid atmosphere of intrigue and betrayal"
"a flyblown bar on the edge of town"
"a squalid overcrowded apartment in the poorest part of town"

means.word_mean: 肮脏的,污秽的,卑鄙的,可耻的,堕落的

sentences.en: The huts they lived in were sordid and filthy beyond belief.
sentences.cn: 他们住的小房真是异乎寻常地脏。

sentences.en: I’ve washed my hands of the whole sordid business.
sentences.cn: 我已经洗手不干那种肮脏的勾当了。

sentences.en: I want no part of this sordid business.
sentences.cn: 我不想卷入这一卑鄙勾当。

sentences.en: Journalists have exercised remarkable restraint in not reporting all the sordid details of the case.
sentences.cn: 记者对该案件的报道显示出异乎寻常的克制，没有报道所有肮脏的细节。
